sections.title: Choose the Structure That Protects and Scales
sections.subtitle: Compare sole proprietorship, LLC, and corporation models with a tax lens

sections.title: What You'll Learn
items: Pros and cons of common business entities
How taxation shifts between pass-through and corporate structures
Compliance checklist for registrations, licenses, and filings
Key conversations to have with legal and tax advisors

sections.title: Protection First, Taxes Second
sections.content: Pick a structure that shields personal assets and supports your funding strategy. LLCs suit most early-stage founders because they offer liability protection with pass-through taxation. When profits grow or investors require preferred stock, evaluate S-Corp election or C-Corp formation.

points.title: Sole Proprietorship
points.description: Fast to set up but no liability shield and self-employment tax on all profits.

points.title: LLC
points.description: Flexible ownership, pass-through taxation, and credibility; consider S-Corp election for payroll tax savings.

points.title: C-Corp
points.description: Preferred for venture funding; double taxation mitigated by deductible benefits and qualified small business stock (QSBS).

sections.title: Track Deadlines
sections.content: File annual reports, franchise taxes, and quarterly estimated taxes on time. Missed deadlines risk penalties and losing good standing.

sections.title: Build Your Advisor Bench
sections.content: At minimum, consult a small-business attorney and CPA once a year. They catch state-specific obligations, draft operating agreements, and optimize tax elections as revenue grows.

sections.title: Entity Setup Checklist
steps: Confirm your business name is available and register it with the state.
Apply for an EIN and open a dedicated business bank account.
Draft an operating agreement or bylaws even if not requiredâ€”clarity prevents future disputes.
Record compliance tasks (sales tax permits, workers' comp, licenses) in your operating calendar.
Schedule quarterly tax reviews to adjust estimated payments based on actual revenue.

sections.title: Separate Everything
sections.content: Never mix personal and business finances. Commingling can pierce the liability shield you worked to secure.
